remarks: Generalized triangle inequality: the absolute value of a finite sum is less than or equal to the sum of absolute values.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Mar-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-May-2014.)
statement:
seqabs.1 $e |- ( ph -> N e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) ) $.
seqabs.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. ( M ... N ) ) -> ( F ` k ) e. CC ) $.
seqabs.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. ( M ... N ) ) -> ( G ` k ) = ( abs ` ( F ` k ) ) ) $.
seqabs $p |- ( ph -> ( abs ` ( seq M ( + , F ) ` N ) ) <_ ( seq M ( + , G ) ` N ) ) $.
$d F k $.
$d G k $.
$d M k $.
$d N k $.
$d k ph $.
